item.text: OSCA would be a searchable archive of high quality 3D models of cells, organelles, complex molecules, organs, pathogens, lab equipment and healthcare delivery models and environments that scientists, educators, policymakers and game designers could use, remix and continually improve on.
[[Open Simulation Archive]] (OSCA) is an open archive of 3D science models and simulations. This ‚Äúbiomedical 3D warehouse‚Äù would be the science equivalent to Google Warehouse.

[[Open Simulation Archive]], or the "open simulation commons archive" (OSCA) is an open archive of 3D science models and simulations. This ‚Äúbiomedical 3D warehouse‚Äù would be the science equivalent to Google Warehouse.

Abbreviated as "OSCA" which is short for the "open simulation commons archive",

Abbreviated as "OSCA" which is short for the "open simulation commons archive", OSCA would be a searchable archive of high quality 3D models of cells, organelles, complex molecules, organs, pathogens, lab equipment and healthcare delivery models and environments that scientists, educators, policymakers and game designers could use, remix and continually improve on.

"OSCA" (which is short for the "open simulation commons archive"), would be a searchable archive of high quality 3D models of cells, organelles, complex molecules, organs, pathogens, lab equipment and healthcare delivery models and environments that scientists, educators, policymakers and game designers could use, remix and continually improve on.

story.text: [[Open Simulation Archive]] is an open archive of 3D science models and simulations. This ‚Äúbiomedical 3D warehouse‚Äù would be the science equivalent to Google Warehouse.

OSCA (which is short for the "open simulation commons archive"), would be a searchable archive of high quality 3D models of cells, organelles, complex molecules, organs, pathogens, lab equipment and healthcare delivery models and environments that scientists, educators, policymakers and game designers could use, remix and continually improve on.
